result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Christopher Dorr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IMPOSED AND STAYED

superMiscConds.notes: If revoked, defendant shall pay court costs as previously ordered.

Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random urinalysis.
Defendant shall have such treatment as DOC deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random urinalysis.
Defendant shall have such treatment as DOC deems appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Christopher Dorr

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody Christopher Dorr in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Cody Christopher Dorr.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to charge. State recommends WSPS 2 years (1 & 1), consecutive to other sentences, court costs. Defense free to argue. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Defendant is still in Treatment Court and given another chance. Court orders WSPS 2 years (1&1), consecutive to other sentences, imposed and stayed, probation two years with conditions: Counseling, random urinalysis, DNA, costs, treatment as deemed appropriate. Conditions for extended supervision are same as probation conditions.

records.addlTxt:
and arrarignment. Defendant Cody Christopher Dorr appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail. Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Cody Christopher Dorr.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court bind matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cody Christopher Dorr in custody appeared by video from Grant Co Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties & right to counsel. Defendant to contact public defender. State recommends signature bond. Courts sets $1000 signature bond with condition to contact public defender. Status conference as to counsel scheduled for 8/25/22 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant shall go to Public Defender's Office.
